TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
How we do moderation things: we see the same forum interface you do, but ours has several more options. 

If you're getting the notification that you can't view a post or thread, it's most likely a broken link to something extremely old, which doesn't exist anymore due to forum software transitions.

Quick question: what is your favorite part of moderating?

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, The Minmus Derp said:
> 
> 
> Quick question: what is your favorite part of moderating?
> 

Helping people.

Lots of little individual instances, e.g.

- A user posted something in the wrong forum.  Move it to the right place so they get better replies.
- A malicious troll is abusing people. Make them stop so that people have a better experience.
- A spammer is polluting the forum and diluting everyone's enjoyment.  Tidy them up.
- A flamewar has erupted, which makes everyone unhappy and everyone loses and the thread is derailed.  Calm it down and get the thread back on track so people can enjoy it.
- (okay, this one's kinda selfish)  Since we're the ones who approve new users' posts from the queue, I get to be the first person who has the chance to say "Hello, and welcome to the forums!" ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

...but what they all have in common is "helping people".

It pretty much has to be that way, I think-- moderating is a tedious and thankless job that one does for free in one's scarce spare time.  About the only actual *<u>payoff</u>* is the opportunity to help people.  So if that weren't how I get my jollies, there's no way I'd want to be doing this.  ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
